description: President-elect Donald Trump will nominate former Congressman Doug Collins for US Secretary for Veterans Affairs, according to a statement posted by Trump transition team spokesperson Karoline Leavitt on social media platform X.
title: Trump to Nominate Doug Collins as Secretary for Veterans Affairs

description: President-elect Donald Trump says he has chosen Todd Blanche for deputy attorney general, according to a statement.
title: Trump Nominates Todd Blanche for Deputy Attorney General

description: As US President Joe Biden arrived in Peru for back-to-back summits with some of the world’s most powerful leaders, his aides expected lots of questions about Donald Trump.
title: Biden Braces for Lots of Trump Questions From World Leaders

description: The most important man at a gathering of world leaders and executives in Peru Thursday wasn’t even in attendance.
title: ‘Read His Book’: Dimon Offers a Tariff Tip as Trump Haunts APEC

description: China wields new powers as it confronts the prospect of another trade conflict with the US, expanding its retaliatory reach in recent years to include tools capable of wreaking havoc on global commerce and finance.
title: China’s Asymmetrical Tools for New Trade War Carry Global Peril

description: President-elect Donald Trump said he wants Jay Clayton to serve as US Attorney for Manhattan, leading the Justice Department office known as being the sheriff of Wall Street.
title: Trump Taps His Ex-SEC Chair Jay Clayton as US Attorney for Manhattan

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior editor Joe Sobczyk looks at how Senate Republicans are handling the Matt Gaetz nomination. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Applies a Loyalty Test to Senate GOP With Gaetz Nomination

description: Canada’s highways, shopping centers, schools and equipment are aging without being replaced as investment in infrastructure slows.
title: Canada’s Infrastructure Keeps Aging as Investment Fails to Keep Up

description: The US Treasury added South Korea to a “monitoring list” for foreign-exchange practices that continues to include Japan and Germany, and reiterated its criticism of China’s lack of transparency with regard to managing its currency.
title: US Adds South Korea to Foreign-Exchange Monitoring Watchlist

description: President-elect Donald Trump said he is tapping Robert F. Kennedy Jr., to run the Department of Health and Human Services, a move that would elevate a prominent vaccine skeptic and pharmaceutical industry critic to a top role on federal health policy.
title: Trump Selects RFK Jr. for Health Secretary; Vaccine Stocks Fall

description: JPMorgan Chase & Co. Chief Executive Officer Jamie Dimon said companies will look harder at acquisitions in the wake of the Trump victory after regulation had chilled deal activity.
title: JPMorgan CEO Dimon Sees Firms Pursuing More M&A Under Trump

description: New York state spent $14.5 billion on home health care services for low-income residents without required proof they took place, an audit by state Comptroller Thomas DiNapoli found.
title: NY State Paid $14.5 Billion for Unverified Home Health Services

description: President Joe Biden’s trade negotiator said the use of targeted tariffs is necessary to guard against China deluging the US with imports such as cars, clean energy and semiconductors.
title: US Trade Chief Says Targeted Tariffs Needed to Avoid China Shock

description: “I respect Jamie Dimon, of JPMorgan Chase, greatly, but he will not be invited to be a part of the Trump Administration,” President-elect Trump says in a post on Truth Social.
title: Trump Says Jamie Dimon Won’t Be Part of New Administration

description: While trade tensions between the US and China are bringing more investments to Southeast Asia, including Malaysia, worries over slower global growth and higher costs loom, according to Malaysia’s trade and investment chief.
title: Malaysia’s Trade Chief Flags Longer Term Pain from US-China Rift

description: During Donald Trump’s hush-money trial last spring, a string of top Republicans turned up at the Manhattan courthouse in a public show of loyalty. Now several are being tapped for his government.
title: Trump Boosters at Hush-Money Trial Rewarded With Top Administration Jobs

description: Peru’s prime minister defended the new leadership at Petroperu against criticism from business groups that said they would slow the restructuring of the heavily indebted state-owned oil company.
title: Peru Prime Minister Backs Controversial New Petroperu Leadership

description: The remaining United Nations mission in Mali will start leaving on Friday to bring an end to the 11-year-old peacekeeping mission that helped the country fight militants seeking to control parts of the country.
title: Last UN Mission in Mali to Pack Out as 11-Year-Old Deployment Ends

description: France’s prime minister said he’ll “probably” need to bypass a vote in parliament to get the nation’s budget adopted.
title: French Premier to ‘Probably’ Bypass Parliament Vote for Budget

description: Demonstrators gathered in Lithuania’s capital to protest the move by the Baltic nation’s Social Democrats to forge a coalition with a party whose leader is accused of making antisemitic remarks.
title: Antisemitism Row Draws Protesters as Lithuanian Lawmakers Gather

description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves believes the UK’s crackdown on banks in the wake of the global financial crisis has gone too far and vowed to give the country’s watchdogs new marching orders to ensure they’re focused on growing the economy.
title: UK Argues Post-Crisis Crackdown on Wall Street Has Gone Too Far

description: A little over a week ago, Italian Finance Minister Giancarlo Giorgetti approached some of the country’s wealthiest investors to finally pull off what his predecessors failed to do: Return Banca Monte dei Paschi di Siena SpA to private ownership while keeping it Italian.
title: How Italy Swayed Its Tycoons to Pile Into Master Plan for Paschi

description: The drop in births in France accelerated last year to the fastest pace in half a century, a further indication that France’s population will continue to age, increasing the burden on the country’s public finances.
title: French Childbirths Decline by Most Since End of Baby Boom

description: Donald Trump hates wind power. John Thune may be poised to protect it.
title: Thune Is Big Fan of Wind Power, an Energy Source Trump Hates

description: Senate Democrats plan to use their last weeks in the majority to try to make public a House sexual misconduct probe into Matt Gaetz, President-elect Donald Trump’s controversial pick for attorney general.
title: Senate Judiciary Chair Demands Release of Gaetz Ethics Probe

description: Nigeria plans to issue eurobonds and Islamic sukuk bonds as part of the debt portion for funding this year’s budget, according to Finance Minister Wale Edun.
title: Nigeria Plans $1.7 Billion Eurobond to Fund Budget

description: The European Union is working on a new package of sanctions aimed at targeting the shadow fleet of tankers Russia is using to get its oil to market, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: EU Readies More Sanctions on Russia’s Shadow Fleet by Year’s End

description: Chile’s top environmental official said in an interview that US leadership in combating global climate change will be missed following Donald Trump’s presidential election win.
title: Chile Says It’ll Miss US Climate Leadership as Trump Takes Over

description: Matt Gaetz’s selection for attorney general has veterans of the first Trump Justice Department reconsidering whether to reenlist.
title: Trump DOJ Alums Rethink Return With Gaetz as Attorney General

description: US regulators led by the Federal Reserve have refused to endorse a plan that would have seen the Basel Committee on Banking Supervision push lenders to disclose their climate risk, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Fed Refuses to Back Basel Climate Plan, Leaving Talks in Limbo

description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s decision to fire Finance Minister Christian Lindner and trigger an early election has thrown a wrench into the government’s fiscal planning.
title: What’s Happening With Germany’s Budget Before the Snap Election

description: The entity behind the satirical news site The Onion, along with families of the Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting victims, are on tap to purchase right-wing provocateur Alex Jones’ Infowars website.
title: The Onion Buys Alex Jones' Infowars With Backing From Sandy Hook Families

description: Algeria’s defense spending is set to surge to a record 3.35 trillion dinars ($25.1 billion), one of the highest levels in the Middle East and North Africa, as the energy-rich OPEC member girds for what it says are unprecedented regional threats.
title: Algeria Hikes Army Spending to $25 Billion Amid Regional Crises

description: Israeli ground forces are expanding their six—week-old sweep of villages in southern Lebanon, triggering new clashes with Hezbollah militants while US-led cease-fire plans remain in limbo.
title: Israeli Forces Move Deeper into Lebanon With Truce Talks on Hold

description: Even San Francisco, a liberal bastion and conservative punching bag, has found itself caught up in the nation’s rightward shift.
title: Even Liberal San Francisco Is Swept Up in Voter Shift Toward Trump

description: Key Square Group LP founder Scott Bessent, one of the top contenders for Treasury secretary under Donald Trump, praised the president-elect’s economic agenda as one that would grow diverse sectors of the economy, as the jockeying for posts in the incoming Cabinet intensifies.
title: Bessent Hails Trump Agenda as Candidates Vie for Treasury Post

description: Deadly protests that have rocked Mozambique’s economy since disputed elections last month are ratcheting up already high risks that the government will be unable to service its domestic debt, according to S&P Global Ratings.
title: S&P Sees Mozambique Unrest Pushing Nation Closer to Debt Default

description: People walk by the entrance of the Lima Convention Center for the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation Summit in Lima, Peru, on Nov. 11. Photographer: Cris Bouroncle/AFP/Getty Images
title: Updates From APEC CEO Summit in Lima

description: Cuba is hemorrhaging people as the economy falters. Now, the country is coming under fresh political pressure as one of the government’s archrivals is poised to start calling foreign-policy shots in Washington.
title: Trump’s Hawkish Cabinet Pick Heightens Pressure on Weakened Cuba

description: Democrats outspent Republicans by more than $300 million in the run-up to the 2024 presidential election. Yet Harris won none of the swing states where the vast majority of spending went.
title: Political Ads Can’t Buy the Presidency

description: Romanian Prime Minister Marcel Ciolacu is favored to win the first round in a presidential election next week and will likely face a runoff against the leader of an ultra-nationalist party, a survey showed.
title: Romanian Premier Keeps Lead in Poll Ahead of Presidential Ballot

description: Far-right leader Marine Le Pen accused French prosecutors of interfering with the democratic process after they called for her to be barred from the next presidential election.
title: Le Pen Says Prosecutors Are Trying to Block French Voter Options

description: The independent board of Ben & Jerry’s has accused its parent company, Unilever Plc, of silencing it on advocating for Palestinian rights, in contravention of an agreement between the two.
title: Ben & Jerry’s Sues Parent Unilever for Muzzling It Over Gaza

description: Europe is making a last-ditch appeal to the outgoing Biden administration to boost American support for Ukraine in order to solidify Kyiv’s position as much as possible before the presidential term ends in January.
title: Europe Seeks Last-Minute Support From Biden to Help Ukraine

description: The president-elect has said he’ll exit the Paris climate accord and ramp up oil and gas production.
title: Trump Aims a ‘Wrecking Ball’ at Climate Policy

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Brazil’s China Pivot Is a Provocation for ‘Tariff Man’ Trump

description: The French government is enlisting the help of external economists to improve fiscal forecasting after errors during the previous administration undermined its efforts to rein in the deficit.
title: France Turns to Economists to Improve Forecasting After Errors

description: President-elect Donald Trump’s threat to slap a universal tariff of up to 20% on all goods exported to the US would be “unwelcome but manageable” for the UK, according to analysis from Bloomberg Economics.
title: Trump Tariffs on UK Would Be ‘Manageable,’ Economists Say

description: Botswana’s new president, Duma Boko, named Bogolo Kenewendo to be the next mines minister as his administration moves to cement a deal the previous government agreed with De Beers that aims to ensure the nation derives greater benefit from its diamond riches.
title: New Botswana Leader Names Mines Minister Before De Beers Talks

description: Israel is hoping Donald Trump’s return to the White House will lead to more cooperation in the Middle East, both on diplomacy and climate issues, an Israeli official said.
title: Israel Hopes Trump Win Builds Middle East Ties, Official Says

description: A Pakistani court rejected former prime minister Imran Khan’s request for lifting charges for hiding income from the sale of gifts obtained from foreign leaders during his time in power.
title: Pakistan Court Rejects Ex-PM Khan Acquittal Request in Case

description: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba’s government is planning ¥30,000 ($192) cash handouts to help low-income households cope with higher prices as it fleshes out the details of an upcoming economic package, according to the latest draft of the plans seen by Bloomberg.
title: Japan Plans $192 Handouts for Low-Income Households in Package

description: Russia’s government is reducing payments made to soldiers suffering lesser injuries in the war on Ukraine as the costs of the invasion pile up.
title: Russia to Reduce Payments for Soldiers Wounded in War

description: South Africa started allowing some movement at its main border with Mozambique on Thursday morning, after protests prompted a suspension the day before.
title: South Africa Partially Reopens Mozambique Border After Unrest

description: The medicines pricing regulator, pharmaceutical companies and government are locked in a row over access to life-extending therapies.
title: Cancer Patients in England Denied Access to Drugs Over Price Standoff

description: Donald Trump’s election victory is prompting South Korea to rethink the possibility of sending weapons directly to Ukraine, a decision that could have a big impact on the direction of the war.
title: Trump’s Win Gives Seoul Second Thoughts About Arms for Ukraine

description: A Malaysian cabinet official said Sunday that the country had received a request from Bangladesh to arrest two businessmen as part of a probe of alleged trafficking of migrant workers, confirming a Bloomberg News report.
title: Malaysia Says It Got Bangladesh Request to Arrest Businessmen

description: By Wednesday afternoon, an eerie quiet hung over the site of China’s deadliest known act of civilian violence in years. As traffic flowed freely past the now-deserted Zhuhai Sports Center Stadium, a yellow-and-black-clad Meituan courier pulled up on his motorbike.
title: China Silences Car Attack Mourners, Vows Tighter Grip on Society

description: US President-elect Donald Trump wants to dismantle the federal bureaucracy and even eliminate at least one federal department. To do that, he’s creating a new agency, called the Department of Government Efficiency.
title: What Can Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency Actually Do?

description: Former House Speaker Kevin McCarthy predicted that President-elect Donald Trump’s nomination of Matt Gaetz to be attorney general would be rejected by the Republican Senate next year.
title: Senate Will Block Trump’s Gaetz Nomination, McCarthy Says

description: Sri Lanka holds its first parliamentary elections since the victory of its outsider leftist president, in a test of his ambitious pledges to combat corruption and rewrite an unpopular International Monetary Fund loan program.
title: Sri Lanka Leader Seeks to Bolster Power With Parliamentary Vote

description: One person died after a blast Wednesday night in front of Brazil’s Supreme Court in the capital Brasilia, forcing officials and staff to evacuate the building.
title: Explosion at Brazil’s Supreme Court Leaves One Person Dead
